data.title: Multiple file select in folder window
data.body: It would be useful to be able to select multiple files in the folders window to either delete or remove them

data.title: Review the Keybinding UI in Command Palette
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14 Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

In this insider release, you have introduced a new UI for keybindings in Command Palette, presenting each key as a separate element, instead of a simple label. I know this is a _personal taste_, but the new UI is taking too much atention while looking for commands. 

Personally, I prefer the original UI (just a label) but I understand the new UI (apply the same UI from the Keyboard Shortcut editor). I didn't find any `User Setting` to choose the UI, but it would be great to have that, or maybe make some changes in the new UI to keep focus in the commands, not the keybindings.

Here is a quick compare:

![command-palette-keybinding-july-insiders](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3781424/27799812-099ad244-5fed-11e7-9a55-d6057b9f84fc.png)

Thanks in advance

data.title: Recursively refresh children on expand in Tree
data.body:
This PR is to fix a problem I noticed when I created https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/29964 

The problem is visible in this video. Note: The same issue occurs when using code in the desktop, this recording is from when I was testing for Sourcegraph

![demo](https://cl.ly/2j2U13143F1N/Screen%20Recording%202017-06-30%20at%2005.05%20pm.gif)

Note how when I expand a folder we have children (a FileMatch) with an icon indicating they are expanded, but the children are not rendered. They get rendered if one collapses FileMatch and then expands. Note: the affected FileMatches are marked as auto expanded, which I believe is somehow related to the root cause of this bug.

The more generic explanation of the issue: If an item is auto-expanded but its parent is not, then when the parent is expanded the item's children are not refreshed. This fix we always recursively refresh. This fix seems a bit heavy handed and potentially a performance regression. So I'd like some guidance.

cc @bpasero

data.title: Recommended Extensions show up even if you disabled them
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.14.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10
- Tested without extensions: Yes

I'm using `"extensions.ignoreRecommendations": true` to disable recommendations.
After one of latest updates (today or yesterday probably) this setting stopped working for me and I see recommendations all the time (in extensions tab, ofc).

Anyone can confirm this?

data.title: Add *.props as a recognized file extension for XML
data.body:
Several MSBuild file extensions where already there including `*.targets`.

`*.props` is becoming increasingly important especially with .NET SDK projects using `Directory.Build.props` so frequently.

data.title: File Selection Misleading on Right Click in VS Code
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Version 1.13.1 (1.13.1)
- OS Version: Mac 10.12.5 (16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select one file with normal click. 
2. and right click the another file and delete , the highlight is not changing to the right clicked one. 

Yes I agree there is a confirm dialog, in most cases that helps me to prevent to delete the wrong file. but in rare case I am deleting the wrong file.

data.title: Unable to launch debugger (gdb) with root permissions.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 4.4.0-83, Kernel 

Steps to Reproduce:

When needing to debug a program that needs root permission (for eg. needs access to RAW socket) then the debugger cannot be used currently. Two possible options:
- Add ability to specify "sudo" in launch configuration. User can then edit visudo to not ask for a password.
- Add ability to specify "sudo" in launch configuration. When starting the debugger VSCode prompts user for root password.

data.title: Remove trailing line breaks.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Remove trailing line breaks by saving the file. (e.g. ctrl + S)

Improves settings 
"files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true,
"files.insertFinalNewline": true,

Or adds a new like: 
"files.removeTrailingNewlines": true

Note: First remove than add by "files.insertFinalNewline".

The goal is "Always ensure only one final line break".

![removetrailinglinebreaks](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28209992/27788682-dc82fd0c-5fe9-11e7-9866-6ef42750883c.gif)

[Feature Request]
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64-bit

data.title: Rename build output to task output when selecting a problem matcher.
Task contribution should allow extension to supress problem matcher attach message
data.body:
Steps:

- workspace with package.json
- Run Task
- Select npm install

Observe: the system ask to attach a problem matcher which is unnecessary unless npm would contribute a specific one.

However it shows that there are tasks where the extension contributing it knows that a problem matcher questions makes no sense. We should support that a extension can flag this.

data.title: npm task detection should add a problem matcher to `npm: install` to detect installation failures
data.body: Would be cool if we can detect errors during npm install. Any failures make it very likely that the `program` will not run successful.

data.title: Powershell ISE profile won't load (Terminal freezes for a couple of minutes)
data.body:
Hi VSCode team,

As mentionned in the title,  I have a PowerShell profile (see gist here under) that works flawlessly on the regular powershell console and the powershell ISE.

Once the file Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1 exists, the ISE terminal seems like it is frozen. (nothing is responding in the ISE Terminal). After a couple of minutes (3/4) the ISE terminal finally responds, but doesn't load the profile (which actually contains only a prompt function) but  didn't load the prompt function.

Using this function we can see the prompt didn't got loaded:

` (get-command prompt).Definition`


- VSCode Version:
1.13.1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6302961/27784798-bb1e1a06-5fdb-11e7-8eab-8f53cd1c403f.png)

- OS Version:
Windows 10 Build 16.3.2
Version: 1511
OSBuild: 10586.916


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create profiles using the following prompt function --> https://gist.github.com/Stephanevg/c91e8d674da8805bab6fc2c8133f60d5

2.  Copy into the following files
"\\ServerName\UserName$\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShellISE_profile.ps1"
"\\ServerName\UserName$\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1"

Reproduces without extensions: No

Thanks in advance!

data.title: Press *TAB* inside of a paired bracket or brace to jump out of the pair.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
At the current time, pressing *TAB* will insert a *TAB* character within the brackets or braces.

The **jump to matching brace shortcut** doesn't jump past the matching brace so that doesn't work. Though I suppose if a **move carat right** was added after whatever code makes the carat move before the brace that could work. Though there is probably a more elegant solution.

data.title: Advanced configurability for the Problems View is needed
data.body:
Coming from Atom, I severely miss the advanced configurablitiy of the "Problems View". See also #7248 and #10400.
 
Things that I'd like to be able to configure:

1. Hide Panel when Empty (makes sense when combined with the items 2. and 3.). And: show when non-empty.
2. Problems View represents Current File
3. Problems View represents Current Line
4. Status bar represents Project, Opened Files, Current File, Current Line
5. Decorate files on the tree to show that they have problems
6. Mark somehow the current file that it is clean or not clean (without looking into problems view and checking if this file has any errors or not).

Here's a screenshot of the advanced configurability of the Atom editor's problems view (linter-ui-default package). It is *VERY* well done and provides all needed functionality.

![atom-problems-configuration](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9781/27783512-cc9647ea-5fd6-11e7-8a62-e8a7c5e42102.png)

data.title: NPM install fails as long as VSCode is open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.15.2|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.4|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.2|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.9.1|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.9.2|
|vscode-style-formatter|dweber019|1.0.0|
|gitlens|eamodio|4.3.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.16.0|
|vsc-material-theme|Equinusocio|1.0.0|
|vscode-guid|heaths|1.0.0|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|docomment|k--kato|0.0.17|
|mssql|ms-mssql|1.0.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.12.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.11.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.4.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.6|
|view-in-browser|qinjia|0.0.5|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.4.1|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|MDTools|seanmcbreen|1.0.1|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|vscode-material-syntax-dark|woodywoodsta|0.1.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open or create an angular2 project
2. Open integrated terminal (Powershell) 
3. run npm i

I receive an error from npm 
`EPERM: operation not permitted, rename`

This happens as long as VSCode is open. When I close it, it works. Seems that VSCode or TypeScript is blocking something. See attached npm log 

[2017-07-03T07_36_18_871Z-debug.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1118817/2017-07-03T07_36_18_871Z-debug.txt)

data.title: When the branch list is too large, Checkout filtering is too slow
data.body:
Hi,

When clicking on the name of the branch at the bottom left, it will display the list of branches to select one to checkout.
If the list is too big, then the filtering will become so slow and annoying (Sometimes you should wait about 10 seconds until the filtered list is displayed)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project that has too many branches with Visual Code
2. Click on the name of the branch at the bottom left to display the list of branches.
3. Start typing in the filter input.

Environment:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64
- Reproduces without extensions: Yes 
- Big list of branches (locally and remotely)

data.title: TypeError: expressionForRoot is not a function
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder using UNC localhost notation with uppercase instead of normal case (e.g. `\\LOCALHOST\c$\GitDevelopment\vscode-distro`)
2. make some changes to files

=> 
```
expressionForRoot is not a function: TypeError: expressionForRoot is not a function
    at ResourceGlobMatcher.matches (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/common/resources.js:132:22)
    at HistoryService.include (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.js:290:41)
    at file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.js:304:76
    at Array.filter (native)
    at HistoryService.removeExcludedFromHistory (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.js:304:41)
    at HistoryService.handleExcludesChange (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.js:293:18)
    at file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.js:132:98
    at CallbackList.invoke (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/base/common/callbackList.js:58:43)
    at Emitter.fire (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/base/common/event.js:91:40)
    at ResourceGlobMatcher.updateExcludes (file:///C:/GitDevelopment/monaco/out/vs/workbench/common/resources.js:115:42)
```

data.title: Improve the syntax highlighting for Markdown on "PowerShell ISE" (color theme)
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.13.1 - OS Version: macOS 10.12.516F73 Reproduces without extensions: Yes --- See the following screenshot. This is Markdown text highlighted with the color theme "PowerShell ISE". But this looks not highlighted. Some syntaxes are highlighted. E.g. the title of URL (`[title](URL)`) But almost all syntax are not. I think it would be nice if these syntaxes are highlighted properly. But I have no idea which colors should be applied to them because PowerShell ISE (software) doesn't support syntax highlighting for Markdown...

data.title: Icon theme: cache icon data optimistically like color themes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It would be nice if icons would show up directly after starting the workbench instead of having to wait for the extension host to be ready. Similar to color themes where the data is stored in local storage, the icons data should also be stored so that the overall experience is smooth.
